Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Logical Operators (AND, OR)Combines multiple conditions=AND(S1>5;S2<2)Both conditions are true => Output is true=OR(S1>5;S2<2)Just 1 condition is true => Output is truehashtag#ExcelTips hashtag#ExcelTraining hashtag#ExcelTutorial hashtag#LearnExcel hashtag#ExcelSkills hashtag#ExcelForBeginners hashtag#DataAnalysis hashtag#SpreadsheetSkills hashtag#ExcelFunctions hashtag#ExcelTricks hashtag#ExcelFormulas hashtag#ExcelSolutions hashtag#MicrosoftExcel hashtag#ProductivityTips hashtag#ExcelAddIns hashtag#ExcelCommunity hashtag#ExcelMagic hashtag#ExcelChallengehashtag#HVAC hashtag#Wearehiring hashtag#Dubai hashtag#UAE hashtag#HVACTechnician hashtag#Chilltech hashtag#CTS hashtag#hiring hashtag#HVACJobs hashtag#HVACTechnicianhashtag#AirConditioning hashtag#HVACMaintenance hashtag#CoolingSolutions hashtag#Refrigeration hashtag#NowHiring hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WeAreHiring hashtag#CareerOpportunity hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#UAEJobs hashtag#GulfJobs hashtag#JobsForIndians hashtag#JobsForPakistanis hashtag#NepalJobshashtag#muthamil hashtag#peckohashtag#QA hashtag#8D hashtag#Operation_manager hashtag#ISO hashtag#IPC620C hashtag#Quality hashtag#hvac hashtag#ChillTech hashtag#CTS hashtag#dubai

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Logical Operators (AND, OR)Combines multiple conditions=AND(S1>5;S2<2)Both conditions are true => Output is true=OR(S1>5;S2<2)Just 1 condition is true => Output is truehashtag#ExcelTips hashtag#ExcelTraining hashtag#ExcelTutorial hashtag#LearnExcel hashtag#ExcelSkills hashtag#ExcelForBeginners hashtag#DataAnalysis hashtag#SpreadsheetSkills hashtag#ExcelFunctions hashtag#ExcelTricks hashtag#ExcelFormulas hashtag#ExcelSolutions hashtag#MicrosoftExcel hashtag#ProductivityTips hashtag#ExcelAddIns hashtag#ExcelCommunity hashtag#ExcelMagic hashtag#ExcelChallengehashtag#HVAC hashtag#Wearehiring hashtag#Dubai hashtag#UAE hashtag#HVACTechnician hashtag#Chilltech hashtag#CTS hashtag#hiring hashtag#HVACJobs hashtag#HVACTechnicianhashtag#AirConditioning hashtag#HVACMaintenance hashtag#CoolingSolutions hashtag#Refrigeration hashtag#NowHiring hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WeAreHiring hashtag#CareerOpportunity hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#UAEJobs hashtag#GulfJobs hashtag#JobsForIndians hashtag#JobsForPakistanis hashtag#NepalJobshashtag#muthamil hashtag#peckohashtag#QA hashtag#8D hashtag#Operation_manager hashtag#ISO hashtag#IPC620C hashtag#Quality hashtag#hvac hashtag#ChillTech hashtag#CTS hashtag#dubai

Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Logical Operators (AND, OR)Combines multiple conditions=AND(S1>5;S2<2)Both conditions are true => Output is true=OR(S1>5;S2<2)Just 1 condition is true => Output is truehashtag#ExcelTips hashtag#ExcelTraining hashtag#ExcelTutorial hashtag#LearnExcel hashtag#ExcelSkills hashtag#ExcelForBeginners hashtag#DataAnalysis hashtag#SpreadsheetSkills hashtag#ExcelFunctions hashtag#ExcelTricks hashtag#ExcelFormulas hashtag#ExcelSolutions hashtag#MicrosoftExcel hashtag#ProductivityTips hashtag#ExcelAddIns hashtag#ExcelCommunity hashtag#ExcelMagic hashtag#ExcelChallengehashtag#HVAC hashtag#Wearehiring hashtag#Dubai hashtag#UAE hashtag#HVACTechnician hashtag#Chilltech hashtag#CTS hashtag#hiring hashtag#HVACJobs hashtag#HVACTechnicianhashtag#AirConditioning hashtag#HVACMaintenance hashtag#CoolingSolutions hashtag#Refrigeration hashtag#NowHiring hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WeAreHiring hashtag#CareerOpportunity hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#UAEJobs hashtag#GulfJobs hashtag#JobsForIndians hashtag#JobsForPakistanis hashtag#NepalJobshashtag#muthamil hashtag#peckohashtag#QA hashtag#8D hashtag#Operation_manager hashtag#ISO hashtag#IPC620C hashtag#Quality hashtag#hvac hashtag#ChillTech hashtag#CTS hashtag#dubai

Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. 🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. 🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. 🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting The Castle of Secrets  Steam page by Serene Questworks matches what the voice actors are saying. Why would the developer admit to using Gen AI Slop for voice acting? To not get removed from Steam.Steam's policy is that if you don't close AI usage and they find out, they remove your game and delist you from Steam. That's a big enough threat that developers are disclosing AI use. For indie game studios looking to cut corners, screwing voice actors is a terrible way to develop.This continues to show the extent of Gen AI in game dev. Gen AI is used for customer support, automated QA, placeholder VO, placeholder 2D art, placeholder localization, placeholder text. Only the truly incompetent and scammers use Gen AI for anything final.-----Castle of Secrets: AI GENERATED CONTENT DISCLOSURE"The developers describe how their game uses AI Generated Content like this:Sometimes generated voice acting"Steam: https://lnkd.in/geHetV2c-----GameDeveloper: "Indie dev Serene Questworks accused of replacing game's cast with AI voices. Generative AI is becoming more prevalent in games, and not every developer is completely honest about their intentions with it." (Justin Carter) (March 11, 2025)Castle of Secrets developer Serene Questworks has been accused of hiring human voice actors, only to fire them and replace them with performances made with generative AI. Voice actor Mika Nerida claimed the studio "decided they wanted to use AI-trained voices" for its debut game, and "canned every voice actor they had, refusing other talent onboard."A picture in the post from Castle's voice director Ian Mitchell shows he was also banned from Castle's Steam hub by a Serene Questworks developer for "personal hostility and imposing their position." The now-deleted post on the game's forums claimed the studio "used AI to make voice actors sound like multiple different people, instead of having the actors act out as the characters. Make it less authentic, as a computer's doing the voices."Nerida told Game Developer she was initially cast under the belief she was meant to replace the game's initial AI placeholder voices. She later alleged Serene "doubled back" and implied AI would be used in some capacity. Both she and Mitchell refused this, after which they and the game's other human actors were "kicked off" the project.Per Mitchell, the actors were fired before voice recording was set to begin. He said the generated voices are more than a simple "voice filter," and they "make you sound like a different person completely. This was to save on costs of different voice actors, even though the voice actors who auditioned could do a MASSIVE range of voices for them.""We asked to just let us voice act, instead of letting the computer do it for us," he continued."GameDeveloper: https://lnkd.in/gxCpGP37hashtag#gameindustry hashtag#voiceacting hashtag#ai hashtag#aislop hashtag#aivoice hashtag#fakeai hashtag#genai hashtag#degenai

INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. 🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting The Castle of Secrets  Steam page by Serene Questworks matches what the voice actors are saying. Why would the developer admit to using Gen AI Slop for voice acting? To not get removed from Steam.Steam's policy is that if you don't close AI usage and they find out, they remove your game and delist you from Steam. That's a big enough threat that developers are disclosing AI use. For indie game studios looking to cut corners, screwing voice actors is a terrible way to develop.This continues to show the extent of Gen AI in game dev. Gen AI is used for customer support, automated QA, placeholder VO, placeholder 2D art, placeholder localization, placeholder text. Only the truly incompetent and scammers use Gen AI for anything final.-----Castle of Secrets: AI GENERATED CONTENT DISCLOSURE"The developers describe how their game uses AI Generated Content like this:Sometimes generated voice acting"Steam: https://lnkd.in/geHetV2c-----GameDeveloper: "Indie dev Serene Questworks accused of replacing game's cast with AI voices. Generative AI is becoming more prevalent in games, and not every developer is completely honest about their intentions with it." (Justin Carter) (March 11, 2025)Castle of Secrets developer Serene Questworks has been accused of hiring human voice actors, only to fire them and replace them with performances made with generative AI. Voice actor Mika Nerida claimed the studio "decided they wanted to use AI-trained voices" for its debut game, and "canned every voice actor they had, refusing other talent onboard."A picture in the post from Castle's voice director Ian Mitchell shows he was also banned from Castle's Steam hub by a Serene Questworks developer for "personal hostility and imposing their position." The now-deleted post on the game's forums claimed the studio "used AI to make voice actors sound like multiple different people, instead of having the actors act out as the characters. Make it less authentic, as a computer's doing the voices."Nerida told Game Developer she was initially cast under the belief she was meant to replace the game's initial AI placeholder voices. She later alleged Serene "doubled back" and implied AI would be used in some capacity. Both she and Mitchell refused this, after which they and the game's other human actors were "kicked off" the project.Per Mitchell, the actors were fired before voice recording was set to begin. He said the generated voices are more than a simple "voice filter," and they "make you sound like a different person completely. This was to save on costs of different voice actors, even though the voice actors who auditioned could do a MASSIVE range of voices for them.""We asked to just let us voice act, instead of letting the computer do it for us," he continued."GameDeveloper: https://lnkd.in/gxCpGP37hashtag#gameindustry hashtag#voiceacting hashtag#ai hashtag#aislop hashtag#aivoice hashtag#fakeai hashtag#genai hashtag#degenai

COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting The Castle of Secrets  Steam page by Serene Questworks matches what the voice actors are saying. Why would the developer admit to using Gen AI Slop for voice acting? To not get removed from Steam.Steam's policy is that if you don't close AI usage and they find out, they remove your game and delist you from Steam. That's a big enough threat that developers are disclosing AI use. For indie game studios looking to cut corners, screwing voice actors is a terrible way to develop.This continues to show the extent of Gen AI in game dev. Gen AI is used for customer support, automated QA, placeholder VO, placeholder 2D art, placeholder localization, placeholder text. Only the truly incompetent and scammers use Gen AI for anything final.-----Castle of Secrets: AI GENERATED CONTENT DISCLOSURE"The developers describe how their game uses AI Generated Content like this:Sometimes generated voice acting"Steam: https://lnkd.in/geHetV2c-----GameDeveloper: "Indie dev Serene Questworks accused of replacing game's cast with AI voices. Generative AI is becoming more prevalent in games, and not every developer is completely honest about their intentions with it." (Justin Carter) (March 11, 2025)Castle of Secrets developer Serene Questworks has been accused of hiring human voice actors, only to fire them and replace them with performances made with generative AI. Voice actor Mika Nerida claimed the studio "decided they wanted to use AI-trained voices" for its debut game, and "canned every voice actor they had, refusing other talent onboard."A picture in the post from Castle's voice director Ian Mitchell shows he was also banned from Castle's Steam hub by a Serene Questworks developer for "personal hostility and imposing their position." The now-deleted post on the game's forums claimed the studio "used AI to make voice actors sound like multiple different people, instead of having the actors act out as the characters. Make it less authentic, as a computer's doing the voices."Nerida told Game Developer she was initially cast under the belief she was meant to replace the game's initial AI placeholder voices. She later alleged Serene "doubled back" and implied AI would be used in some capacity. Both she and Mitchell refused this, after which they and the game's other human actors were "kicked off" the project.Per Mitchell, the actors were fired before voice recording was set to begin. He said the generated voices are more than a simple "voice filter," and they "make you sound like a different person completely. This was to save on costs of different voice actors, even though the voice actors who auditioned could do a MASSIVE range of voices for them.""We asked to just let us voice act, instead of letting the computer do it for us," he continued."GameDeveloper: https://lnkd.in/gxCpGP37hashtag#gameindustry hashtag#voiceacting hashtag#ai hashtag#aislop hashtag#aivoice hashtag#fakeai hashtag#genai hashtag#degenai

🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#Candidatos hashtag#Transparencia hashtag#JusticiaLaboral hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HiringProcess hashtag#TalentHunting hashtag#HRInsights hashtag#Headhunting The Castle of Secrets  Steam page by Serene Questworks matches what the voice actors are saying. Why would the developer admit to using Gen AI Slop for voice acting? To not get removed from Steam.Steam's policy is that if you don't close AI usage and they find out, they remove your game and delist you from Steam. That's a big enough threat that developers are disclosing AI use. For indie game studios looking to cut corners, screwing voice actors is a terrible way to develop.This continues to show the extent of Gen AI in game dev. Gen AI is used for customer support, automated QA, placeholder VO, placeholder 2D art, placeholder localization, placeholder text. Only the truly incompetent and scammers use Gen AI for anything final.-----Castle of Secrets: AI GENERATED CONTENT DISCLOSURE"The developers describe how their game uses AI Generated Content like this:Sometimes generated voice acting"Steam: https://lnkd.in/geHetV2c-----GameDeveloper: "Indie dev Serene Questworks accused of replacing game's cast with AI voices. Generative AI is becoming more prevalent in games, and not every developer is completely honest about their intentions with it." (Justin Carter) (March 11, 2025)Castle of Secrets developer Serene Questworks has been accused of hiring human voice actors, only to fire them and replace them with performances made with generative AI. Voice actor Mika Nerida claimed the studio "decided they wanted to use AI-trained voices" for its debut game, and "canned every voice actor they had, refusing other talent onboard."A picture in the post from Castle's voice director Ian Mitchell shows he was also banned from Castle's Steam hub by a Serene Questworks developer for "personal hostility and imposing their position." The now-deleted post on the game's forums claimed the studio "used AI to make voice actors sound like multiple different people, instead of having the actors act out as the characters. Make it less authentic, as a computer's doing the voices."Nerida told Game Developer she was initially cast under the belief she was meant to replace the game's initial AI placeholder voices. She later alleged Serene "doubled back" and implied AI would be used in some capacity. Both she and Mitchell refused this, after which they and the game's other human actors were "kicked off" the project.Per Mitchell, the actors were fired before voice recording was set to begin. He said the generated voices are more than a simple "voice filter," and they "make you sound like a different person completely. This was to save on costs of different voice actors, even though the voice actors who auditioned could do a MASSIVE range of voices for them.""We asked to just let us voice act, instead of letting the computer do it for us," he continued."GameDeveloper: https://lnkd.in/gxCpGP37hashtag#gameindustry hashtag#voiceacting hashtag#ai hashtag#aislop hashtag#aivoice hashtag#fakeai hashtag#genai hashtag#degenai

Top 22 Excel Formulas10x your productivity with these 22 Excel must-known formulas:1. SUMAdds all numbers in a range=SUM(A1:A9)Add values from cell A1 to A 92. AVERAGECalculates the average of numbers in a range=AVE RAGE(B1:B9)Average of B1 t o B93. ROUNDRounds a number to a specified number of digits= ROUND(C1;2)Round C1 to 2 decimal places4. MINIdentifies the lowest number in a range=MIN(D1:D9)Find the minim um in D1 to D95. MAXFinds the highest number in a range=MAX(D1:D9)Get the maximum value in D1 to D96. COUNTCounts the number of cells that contain numbers=C OUNT(F1:F9)Count numeric cells in F1 to F9*It only counts the numerical inputs7. INDEXReturns a value in table based on row & column number=INDEX (K1:L10,2,3)For the value i n the 2nd row & 3rd column from the range K1:K108. MATCHSearches for a value and returns its relative position=MATCH (L1,M1:M9,0)To find L1's position from the range M1:M99. VLOOKUPSearches for a value in the first column of a range=VLOOKUP (G1,H1:H10,2,FALSE)To find G1 in H1:H1010. HLOOKUPSearches for a value in the top row of a tableNumber of rows that contains the data you want to retrieve=HLOOKU P(I1,J1:S2,2,FALSE)To f ind I1 in the top row J1:S211. XLOOKUPFinds a value in one range & returns a result from another=XLOOKUP(A7,A2:A4,B2:C4)To find A7 in A2:A4 & return the corresponding value from B2:C4 if a match is found12. COUNTIF/COUNTIFSCounts cells that meet a condition=COUNT IF (N1:N9;">5")To count cells greater tha n 513. COUNTACounts non-empty cells=COUNTA(O1:O9)To coun t all non-em pty cells in a range14. SUMIF / SUMIFSCounts non-empty cells=SUMIF( P1:P9,">5")Add cells that meet a condition15. IF / NESTED IFSPerforms conditional tests=IF(R 1>5;"Yes";"No")For simple conditionsNote:IF: 1 variableIFS: multiple variables=IF(test, true, false)=IF(test1, true, IF(test2, true, false)Nested IF=IFS(test1, true, test2, true, test3, true)16. AVERAGEIF / AVERAGEIFSCalculates the average for cells that meet criteria=AVER AGEIF(Q1:Q9;">5")Average of values over 517. Logical Operators (AND, OR)Combines multiple conditions=AND(S1>5;S2<2)Both conditions are true => Output is true=OR(S1>5;S2<2)Just 1 condition is true => Output is truehashtag#ExcelTips hashtag#ExcelTraining hashtag#ExcelTutorial hashtag#LearnExcel hashtag#ExcelSkills hashtag#ExcelForBeginners hashtag#DataAnalysis hashtag#SpreadsheetSkills hashtag#ExcelFunctions hashtag#ExcelTricks hashtag#ExcelFormulas hashtag#ExcelSolutions hashtag#MicrosoftExcel hashtag#ProductivityTips hashtag#ExcelAddIns hashtag#ExcelCommunity hashtag#ExcelMagic hashtag#ExcelChallengehashtag#HVAC hashtag#Wearehiring hashtag#Dubai hashtag#UAE hashtag#HVACTechnician hashtag#Chilltech hashtag#CTS hashtag#hiring hashtag#HVACJobs hashtag#HVACTechnicianhashtag#AirConditioning hashtag#HVACMaintenance hashtag#CoolingSolutions hashtag#Refrigeration hashtag#NowHiring hashtag#HiringAlert hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#WeAreHiring hashtag#CareerOpportunity hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#UAEJobs hashtag#GulfJobs hashtag#JobsForIndians hashtag#JobsForPakistanis hashtag#NepalJobshashtag#muthamil hashtag#peckohashtag#QA hashtag#8D hashtag#Operation_manager hashtag#ISO hashtag#IPC620C hashtag#Quality hashtag#hvac hashtag#ChillTech hashtag#CTS hashtag#dubai

Currently, we are hiring one Senior Automation QA Engineer. Suppose you are interested in this job. Please note me and share your resume.Key Responsibilities: 1. Automation Test Development:•  Develop robust and reusable Python-based automation test scripts using Pytest, Playwright, and Selenium. Let’s list specific skills under required or desired skills.• Build end-to-end UI automation and CLI-based automation for network switch products and related web interfaces.• Implement API-level automation testing where applicable.• Build modular and scalable automation suites to validate new features and conduct regression testing. 2. Test Case Analysis and Development:• Collaborate with manual QA (cross functional QA teams?) to analyze test cases and ensure test steps are optimized, simplified, and cover all key validation checkpoints.• Design and document test cases based on feature requirements, product specifications, and networking protocols.• Ensure maximum test coverage across functional, performance, and negative test cases. 3. Debugging and Defect Analysis:• Execute automated test suites and analyze failures to isolate issues.• Work closely with Product Engineers (PE) and Developers to troubleshoot automation failures and escalate software issues.• Support root cause analysis and document defects clearly using bug-tracking tools like JIRA. Let’s list JIRA as a required or desired skill 4. Regression Testing and Release Support:• Execute automated regression testing as part of product release cycles.• Ensure test execution aligns with product release schedules and quality standards.• Continuously enhance automation coverage as new features are introduced. Required Qualifications: Technical Skills:• 5+ years of experience in networking product testing, with a focus on switch, router, or network device validation.• Strong Python programming skills (minimum 3 years of hands-on development experience).• Hands-on experience with automation frameworks:• Pytest (test execution and reporting)• Playwright or Selenium (UI automation)• Familiarity with L2 networking protocols:• VLAN, LAG, LLDP, ARP, STP• Network configuration and troubleshooting using CLI• Experience in network-related application testing and network environment setup.• Strong knowledge of Linux-based test environments.• Understanding of test automation in CI/CD pipelines. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Knowledge of REST APIs and experience writing API test automation scripts.• Familiarity with Packet capture tools (e.g., Wireshark) and network debugging.• Knowledge of Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible for testbed automation.• Prior experience in Pro AV, multimedia switching, or IP-based video distribution products is a plus.·     Familiarity with L/3 networking protocols

🔥 ¿Realmente buscan talento o solo juegan con los candidatos?Después de varios procesos de selección, entrevistas y pruebas técnicas, quiero hablar de algo que, aunque todos sabemos que pasa, parece que nadie quiere decirlo en voz alta.✅ El guion siempre es el mismo:🔹 “¡Nos urge cerrar la vacante!”🔹 “Tu perfil es justo lo que buscamos.”🔹 “El proceso será rápido.”Te emocionas, te preparas, pasas entrevistas y pruebas técnicas (a veces largas y no pagadas)… y luego viene el infame silencio:❌ Correos sin responder.❌ Visto en WhatsApp.❌ Llamadas ignoradas.Y si logras que te respondan, siempre es la misma historia:🔸 “El cliente aún no decide.” (pero siguen entrevistando más gente)🔸 “El cliente canceló la vacante.” (pero sigue publicada una y otra vez)🔸 “Tu perfil es excelente, pero queremos evaluar más opciones.” (traducción: quieren pagar menos)🔸 “Estamos esperando aprobación.” (y seis meses después, la misma vacante sigue publicada)💼 Algunas verdades incómodas:📌 Piden 10 años de experiencia en tecnologías que existen hace 5.📌 Vacantes “urgentes” que terminan en procesos eternos o que mágicamente desaparecen.📌 Exigen un perfil Full Stack, pero con responsabilidades de DevOps, QA, SysAdmin y hasta Scrum Master, por un sueldo que apenas supera al de un becario.📌 Múltiples entrevistas, pruebas técnicas absurdas y exámenes interminables, solo para que al final elijan a alguien más barato o el proceso se cancele sin ninguna explicación.📌 “Buscamos el match perfecto”, pero cuando el candidato pide un sueldo acorde a su experiencia, mágicamente el presupuesto se reduce.📌 Piden honestidad en los CVs, pero no dan feedback, no responden mensajes y dejan a los candidatos en el limbo.💡 Entonces, ¿falta talento o falta estrategia en el reclutamiento?Se habla de escasez de talento, pero lo que realmente hay es:🚩 Procesos de selección mal estructurados.🚩 Expectativas irreales y sueldos que no corresponden con la experiencia requerida.🚩 Falta de compromiso con los candidatos.💼 A los reclutadores y headhunters:Si una vacante sigue abierta durante meses o años, tal vez el problema no es el candidato, sino su proceso de selección.Si ya entrevistaron a alguien y no lo seleccionaron, tengan la decencia de darle un cierre honesto en lugar de ignorarlo.No jueguen con el tiempo ni las esperanzas de las personas.📢 Candidatos, ¿les ha pasado? ¿Qué es lo más absurdo que les han dicho en un proceso de selección?Reclutadores, si creen que estoy equivocado, los leo en los comentarios. 👇hashtag#Reclutamiento hashtag#Hiring hashtag#RRHH hashtag#Respeto hashtag#Trabajo The Castle of Secrets  Steam page by Serene Questworks matches what the voice actors are saying. Why would the developer admit to using Gen AI Slop for voice acting? To not get removed from Steam.Steam's policy is that if you don't close AI usage and they find out, they remove your game and delist you from Steam. That's a big enough threat that developers are disclosing AI use. For indie game studios looking to cut corners, screwing voice actors is a terrible way to develop.This continues to show the extent of Gen AI in game dev. Gen AI is used for customer support, automated QA, placeholder VO, placeholder 2D art, placeholder localization, placeholder text. Only the truly incompetent and scammers use Gen AI for anything final.-----Castle of Secrets: AI GENERATED CONTENT DISCLOSURE"The developers describe how their game uses AI Generated Content like this:Sometimes generated voice acting"Steam: https://lnkd.in/geHetV2c-----GameDeveloper: "Indie dev Serene Questworks accused of replacing game's cast with AI voices. Generative AI is becoming more prevalent in games, and not every developer is completely honest about their intentions with it." (Justin Carter) (March 11, 2025)Castle of Secrets developer Serene Questworks has been accused of hiring human voice actors, only to fire them and replace them with performances made with generative AI. Voice actor Mika Nerida claimed the studio "decided they wanted to use AI-trained voices" for its debut game, and "canned every voice actor they had, refusing other talent onboard."A picture in the post from Castle's voice director Ian Mitchell shows he was also banned from Castle's Steam hub by a Serene Questworks developer for "personal hostility and imposing their position." The now-deleted post on the game's forums claimed the studio "used AI to make voice actors sound like multiple different people, instead of having the actors act out as the characters. Make it less authentic, as a computer's doing the voices."Nerida told Game Developer she was initially cast under the belief she was meant to replace the game's initial AI placeholder voices. She later alleged Serene "doubled back" and implied AI would be used in some capacity. Both she and Mitchell refused this, after which they and the game's other human actors were "kicked off" the project.Per Mitchell, the actors were fired before voice recording was set to begin. He said the generated voices are more than a simple "voice filter," and they "make you sound like a different person completely. This was to save on costs of different voice actors, even though the voice actors who auditioned could do a MASSIVE range of voices for them.""We asked to just let us voice act, instead of letting the computer do it for us," he continued."GameDeveloper: https://lnkd.in/gxCpGP37hashtag#gameindustry hashtag#voiceacting hashtag#ai hashtag#aislop hashtag#aivoice hashtag#fakeai hashtag#genai hashtag#degenai
